G4531.def: to cause something to move back and forth rapidly, often violently

G5613.def: a relatively weak marker of a relationship between events or states{N:001}

G4160.def: a marker of an agent relation with a numerable event

G2443.def: a marker of purpose for events and states (sometimes occurring in highly elliptical contexts){N:001}

G3306.def: to remain in the same place over a period of time{N:001}

10.gl: to make clear to make evident

18.gl: to move from one place to another

G1352.def: a relatively emphatic marker of result, usually denoting the fact that the inference is self-evident{N:001}{N:002}

G3880.def: to take or bring someone along with

G761.def: pertaining to that which cannot be moved

G932.def: the action of ruling as a king, with the implication of complete authority and the possibility of being able to pass on the right to rule to one’s son or near kin

G2192.def: to have or possess objects or property (in the technical sense of having control over the use of such objects){N:001}{N:002}

G5485.def: to show kindness to someone, with the implication of graciousness on the part of the one showing such kindness

G1223.def: (with the genitive) a marker of intermediate agent, with implicit or explicit causative agent

G3739.def: a relative reference to any entity, event, or state, either occurring overtly in the immediate context or clearly implied in the discourse or setting

G3000.def: to perform religious rites as a part of worship{N:001}

G3588.def: a reference to an entity, event, or state, clearly identified by the linguistic or non-linguistic context of the utterance{N:001}

G2316.def: the one supreme supernatural being as creator and sustainer of the universe

G2102.def: pertaining to that which causes someone to be pleased

G3326.def: a marker of an associative relation, usually with the implication of being in the company of{N:001}

G1063.def: a marker of cause or reason between events, though in some contexts the relation is often remote or tenuous

G3588.def: a reference to an entity, event, or state, clearly identified by the linguistic or non-linguistic context of the utterance{N:001}

G2316.def: the one supreme supernatural being as creator and sustainer of the universe

G2654.def: to destroy completely, with the possible implication of something being used up or consumed

G4442.def: the light, flames, and heat produced by the burning of materials
